ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right ear acute tympanic membrane perforation with mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of severe infection and spontaneous rupture, confirmed by large ear canal volume on tympanometry and air-bone gaps.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left ear sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiogram shows mild sloping to moderate sensorineural hearing loss with normal middle ear function.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree and configuration of hearing loss given the sudden change.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess middle ear status and confirm the suspected perforation.
To evaluate the integrity of the acoustic reflex arc.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with asymmetric hearing loss. The right ear demonstrates a profound mixed hearing loss with very poor word recognition, consistent with the history of acute infection and rupture. Tympanometry confirms a perforation in the right ear (large volume). The left ear shows a stable mild-to-moderate sensorineural hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear profound mixed loss rising to moderately severe (250-4000 Hz) then sloping to severe. Left ear flat mild sloping to moderate SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear SRT 102 dB HL, WRS 10% (very poor). Left ear SRT 45 dB HL, WRS 70% (moderate difficulty).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear flat (Type B) with large ear canal volume (7.1 mL), indicating perforation. Left ear normal (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ear reflexes absent. Left ear ipsilateral present, contralateral absent.

proposed_items: Discontinue hearing aid use in the right ear until infection clears
Water precautions for the right ear
counseling_actions: Explain the tympanic membrane perforation and its cause
Instruct on the proper use of antibiotic ear drops
Instruct to keep the right ear dry and use water precautions
Advise against wearing the hearing aid in the right ear until cleared
Discuss the follow-up plan to monitor healing

escalation.rationale_short: Immediate management of acute infection and tympanic membrane perforation.

follow_up_plan.objective: To determine if the perforation is healing on its own or if surgical intervention is needed.
